title: U.S. gasoline motor fuel taxes July 2019
summary: In 2019 , it was found that people in the U.S. with a Master 's degree in State_excise_tax had the highest Cents starting per , at 54.57 gallon .
People who held a Master 's degree in Other_state_taxes/fees and had the second highest starting per , at 11.32 gallon .
An abundance of Masters As higher education in the U.S. has become more common , and even expected , the number of Master 's degrees awarded has increased .

data.Tax: Total state plus federal excise taxes

gold: This statistic represents the U.S. gasoline motor fuel taxes as of July 2019 . Consumers in the United States had to pay state and federal gasoline motor fuel taxes of around 54.6 U.S. dollar cents per gallon . In 2018 , the average annual retail price of gasoline in the United States came to around 2.72 U.S. dollars .
